intro: Navia crispa, commonly known as the crinkled navia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves. Navia crispa thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
